verses.kjv: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.
verses.web: When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
verses.ct: When the Lamb opened the 7th seal, all of heaven fell completely silent for about half an hour.

verses.kjv: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.
verses.web: I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.
verses.ct: Then I saw the 7 angels who stand in God's presence, and each one was given a trumpet.

verses.kjv: And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given unto him much incense, that he should offer it with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.
verses.web: Another angel came and stood over the altar, having a golden censer. Much incense was given to him, that he should add it to the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar which was before the throne.
verses.ct: Another angel came and stood at the altar, holding a golden censer. He was given a large amount of incense to offer alongside the prayers of all God's people on the golden altar that stands before the throne.

verses.kjv: And the smoke of the incense, which came with the prayers of the saints, ascended up before God out of the angel’s hand.
verses.web: The smoke of the incense, with the prayers of the saints, went up before God out of the angel’s hand.
verses.ct: The smoke of the incense rose up from the angel's hand into God's presence, carrying with it the prayers of his people.

verses.kjv: And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and cast it into the earth: and there were voices, and thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.
verses.web: The angel took the censer, and he filled it with the fire of the altar, then threw it on the earth. Thunders, sounds, lightnings, and an earthquake followed.
verses.ct: Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and hurled it down to the earth. Immediately there came peals of thunder, rumbling voices, flashes of lightning, and an earthquake.

verses.kjv: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.
verses.web: The seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.
verses.ct: The 7 angels with the 7 trumpets prepared to blow them.

verses.kjv: The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up.
verses.web: The first sounded, and there followed hail and fire, mixed with blood, and they were thrown to the earth. One third of the earth was burned up, and one third of the trees were burned up, and all green grass was burned up.
verses.ct: The 1st angel blew his trumpet, and hail and fire mixed with blood came crashing down on the earth. A 3rd of the trees burned up, and every blade of green grass was destroyed.

verses.kjv: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;
verses.web: The second angel sounded, and something like a great burning mountain was thrown into the sea. One third of the sea became blood,
verses.ct: The 2nd angel blew his trumpet, and something like a massive mountain engulfed in flames was thrown into the sea. A 3rd of the sea turned to blood,

verses.kjv: And the third part of the creatures which were in the sea, and had life, died; and the third part of the ships were destroyed.
verses.web: and one third of the living creatures which were in the sea died. One third of the ships were destroyed.
verses.ct: a 3rd of all the living creatures in the sea died, and a 3rd of the ships were destroyed.

verses.kjv: And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters;
verses.web: The third angel sounded, and a great star fell from the sky, burning like a torch, and it fell on one third of the rivers, and on the springs of the waters.
verses.ct: The 3rd angel blew his trumpet, and a great star blazing like a torch fell from heaven. It landed on a 3rd of the rivers and on the freshwater springs.

verses.kjv: And the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.
verses.web: The name of the star is called “Wormwood.” One third of the waters became wormwood. Many people died from the waters, because they were made bitter.
verses.ct: The star's name was Wormwood. A 3rd of all the waters turned bitter like wormwood, and many people died from drinking the poisoned water.

verses.kjv: And the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened, and the day shone not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.
verses.web: The fourth angel sounded, and one third of the sun was struck, and one third of the moon, and one third of the stars; so that one third of them would be darkened, and the day wouldn’t shine for one third of it, and the night in the same way.
verses.ct: The 4th angel blew his trumpet, and a 3rd of the sun was struck dark, along with a 3rd of the moon and a 3rd of the stars. Daylight lost a 3rd of its brightness, and the night sky grew equally dark.

verses.kjv: And I beheld, and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, which are yet to sound!
verses.web: I saw, and I heard an eagle, flying in mid heaven, saying with a loud voice, “Woe! Woe! Woe for those who dwell on the earth, because of the other voices of the trumpets of the three angels, who are yet to sound!”
verses.ct: Then I looked and heard an angel flying high overhead, crying out in a loud voice, "Woe! Woe! Woe to everyone living on the earth! The remaining 3 angels have not yet blown their trumpets — and what's coming will be far worse!"
